column4: Anyone know anything about using phones as tethered modems in linux?
its been a while...do you actually have a analog modem on your cellphone?
it works off the highspeed network, it works nicely and i get good speeds.. my wireless modem just crapped out on me, so it's kind of a necessity
I'm just not quite sure how to go about using it in linux.
let me put it differently, do you get like isdn off of your phone or a tethered analog modem is attached to your cellphone? i wanted to clarify first
no, i dial #777 on the phone, and it connects to their data servers, not like dialing a NetZero number or anything.
kinda like using the internet ON the phone, except through the computer.
ahh, okay, i have not used that service, but I assume the ISP/cellfone company has a server you need to log-on to before allowing your data through?
i think i found some good information, im gonna go downstairs and try it out, PM me if you have anything to say.
you may have to check with your isp provider how to logon first
i have the login details, i can't actually get the phone to dial out is the problem
one thing to be concerned too is, are those synchronous or asynchronous data.. it can make a difference on how ppp initial interaction with the isp
but ppp is synchronous, so ppp has to get into like  Hayes modem AT command mode then switch to synch mode
no clue how to do that?
am not sure how to do that dialing part ..has to be asynch or if synch, the clocking coming off the modem in your phone has to beat exactly at correct speeds
i noticed Ubuntu does not have setserial command
